title: Am I the only one who thinks Xayah is poorly designed?
body:
W. ACTIVE: Xayah creates a storm of blades for 4 seconds that grant her attack speed and cause her basic attacks to strike an additional time for 20% damage.

BONUS ATTACK SPEED:
30 / 35 / 40 / 45 / 50%
If Deadly Plumage strikes an enemy champion, Xayah gains 30% movement speed for 1.5 seconds.

Her W just seems op too me, she can build so much more straight damage than a regular ADC because she has an incredible attack speed steroid. The movement speed steroid makes it easy to kite people, and then for somereason she gets 20% bonus damage. 

Her E allows her to easily kite and escape and does metric fuck tons of damage. Like don't even try to kill her if you're a melee because she will just CC you to death. 

Her ultimate is fucking stupid. 1.5 second untargetable that basically gives her a free E snare. She just holds on to it until someone tries to kill her and then she runs away and Es them back for a free escape. 

I don't know I find her pretty overwhelming for an adc.

Now that you put it that way, she's definitely not strong.

I find her underwhelming by current meta standards. Her damage output is nowhere near things like Vayne/Trist/Kog/Twitch.

She seems overpowered, but everyone else is broken so it doesn't matter.

1. Her W is strong, no doubt. That said, she's a hypercarry and it's her main source of sustained damage. 
2. Her E is very good, but is countered by approaching Xayah at an angle so as not to have too many feathers directly behind you.
3. Her ult is like Fizz's troll pole, but it's on a long CD and can't cross walls. The main difference is the champion it's on. Xayah is hyper-carry, while Fizz is an assassin.

For the most part, I think Xayah is fine.

There is, however, one thing that needs toning down.

Her W's AD ratio should scale up with rank, rather than being full at rank 1.

She's a hypercarry, yet her W lets her be a complete lane bully with certain supports (Rakan especiallly).
